answers.answer: It depends on how long it has been since the caesarean most doctors will not do a vbac if it hasn't been at least 20 months due to the risk of uterine rupture
It also depends on the incision. If it's a normal bikini incision they will do one. You would have to make sure the type of incision for both the exterior and the uterus.

My doctor told me that I could choose between csection or vaginal and my first will be 3 weeks shy of 2 weeks. She said I was at a high risk for the same problems to reoccur. My daughter I got stuck in the birth canal. Idk what your chances are since idk what triggered your first to cause preeclampsia. What did your doctor say?
I had the same thing and have been on meds this time since 6wks to try to prevent preeclamplsia tjis time but am still considered high risk and am scheduling a csection. I had it severely tho.

question: If I Had A Cesarean Delivery With My First Child Due To Preeclampsia & My Daughter Not Getting Enough Of Oxygen , What's My Chances Of Having Another Cesarean?
title: What Do You Think?
